thread.title: Sheridan Smith shows off 'Daddy's Girl' tattoo as she makes triumphant return to the stage following father's death
thread.title_full: Sheridan Smith shows off 'Daddy's Girl' tattoo as she makes triumphant return to the stage following father's death

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Sheridan Smith shows off 'Daddy's Girl' tattoo as she makes triumphant return to the stage following father's death
text:
Sheridan Smith shows off 'Daddy's Girl' tattoo as she makes triumphant return to the stage following father's death The actress lost her beloved father to cancer late last year Share Daddy's Girl: Sheridan Smith (Photo: Getty) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Sheridan Smith appeared to be in good spirits as she made a triumphant return to the stage for the first time since her beloved father Colin passed away. 
The 35-year-old performed two songs from her West End show Funny Girl at the star-studded opening of Bunga Bunga in London's Covent Garden on Thursday night. 
Sheridan cut a striking figure in a gold lame wrap around dress which highlighted her impressive frame as she belted out the tracks. 
The actress and singer lost her beloved father to cancer at the age of 80 late last year. 
In tribute to him, she showed off a 'Daddy's Girl' tattoo on her right forearm. The star sang People and Don’t Rain on My Parade from Funny Girl (Photo: Getty Images Europe) The star was all smiles (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Following his death, Sheridan pulled out of the Royal Variety Performance and had also previously taken a two month break from her role in Funny Girl due to stress. 
However, this week it was reported she has landed a huge new TV role. 
She’s on Dave this month reading a tale on Crackanory – and new drama Clean Break, which starts filming in the autumn, could lead to the actress sweeping up award nominations. Read More The actress showed off a 'Daddy's Girl' tattoo (Photo: Getty Images Europe) In her element: Sheridan Smith (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Sheridan Smith was also joined by Jonny Woo on stage at Thursday's launch event (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Sheridan will play skint mum Sam, who scrubs a City trading office on a zero-hours contract to earn enough cash to feed her kids – and stop her estranged husband gaining custody. 
ITV drama boss Polly Hill said: “Sheridan is perfect for the role of Sam and I’m thrilled she’s returning to ITV to play her. 
"It’s a wonderful script that finds real humour and joy in the human struggle to survive.” Like us on Facebook
